main event: A reddish-orange pulsating object was observed in the sky over Columbus, Ohio on November 15, 1965.
interesting points: The object was observed for 3 minutes and 30 seconds, with the witness stating it appeared to 'close' after about 5 seconds.
The object did not make any sound and had sharply outlined edges.
The witness could not estimate the speed or distance of the object, and did not attempt to measure its angular size.
The object did not move behind or in front of any clouds during the sighting.
This was the first time the witness had seen a similar object.
